text: Comfort for God’s People
“Comfort; comfort my people,” says your God.
“Speak to the heart of Jerusalem, and call to her,
that her compulsory labor is fulfilled, that her sin is paid for,
that she has ⸤received⸥\f + \fr 40:2 \ft Literally “taken” \f* from the hand of Yahweh double for all her sins.”
A voice \add is\add* calling in the wilderness, “Clear the way of Yahweh!
Make a highway smooth in the desert for our God!
Every valley shall be lifted up,
and every mountain and hill shall become low,
And the rough ground shall be like a plain,
and the rugged ground like a valley-plain.
And the glory of Yahweh shall be revealed,
and all ⸤humankind⸥\f + \fr 40:5 \ft Literally “flesh” \f* together shall see \add it\add*,
for the mouth of Yahweh has spoken.”
A voice \add is\add* saying, “Call!”
And he said, “What shall I call?”
All ⸤humankind⸥\f + \fr 40:6 \ft Literally “flesh” \f* \add are\add* grass,
and all his loyalty \add is\add* like the flowers of the field.
Grass withers; \add the\add* flower withers
when the breath of Yahweh blows on it.
Surely the people \add are\add* grass.
Grass withers; \add the\add* flower withers,
but\f + \fr 40:8 \ft Or “and” \f* the word of our God will stand forever.
⸤Get yourself⸥\f + \fr 40:9 \ft Literally “Go for you” \f* up to a high mountain, Zion, bringer of good news!
Lift up your voice with strength, Jerusalem, bringer of good news!
Lift \add it\add* up; you must not fear!
Say to the cities of Judah, “Here \add is\add* your God!”
Look! The Lord Yahweh comes with ⸤strength⸥,\f + \fr 40:10 \ft Literally “strong” \f*
and his arm rules for him.
Look! His reward \add is\add* with him,
and his recompense ⸤in his presence⸥.\f + \fr 40:10 \ft Literally “before his face” \f*
He will feed his flock like a shepherd;
he will gather \add the\add* lambs in his arm,
and he will carry \add them\add* in his bosom;
he will lead those who nurse.
Who has measured \add the\add* waters in the hollow of his hand
and marked off \add the\add* heavens with \add a\add* span,
comprehended the dust of the earth in \add a\add* third of a measure
and weighed out \add the\add* mountains in the scales,\f + \fr 40:12 \ft Hebrew “scale” \f* and \add the\add* hills in a balance?
Who has measured up the spirit of Yahweh
or informed him \add as\add* ⸤his counselor⸥\f + \fr 40:13 \ft Literally “the man of his counsel” \f*?
With whom has he consulted, that\f + \fr 40:14 \ft Or “and” \f* he enlightened him\f + \fr 40:14 \ft Or “made him understand” \f*
and taught him \add the\add* path of justice,
and taught him knowledge,
and made \add the\add* way of understanding known to him?
Look! \add The\add* nations \add are\add* like a drop from a bucket,
and they are counted like dust of \add the\add* balances!
Look! He weighs \add the\add* islands like a thin covering.
And Lebanon \add is\add* not enough to light a fire,
and its animals\f + \fr 40:16 \ft Hebrew “animal” \f* not enough for a burnt offering.
All the nations \add are\add* like nothing before him;
they are counted by him as\f + \fr 40:17 \ft Or “from” \f* nothing and emptiness.
And to whom will you liken God?
And to what likeness will you compare him?
A craftsman pours out the idol,
and a ⸤goldsmith⸥\f + \fr 40:19 \ft Literally “refiner” \f* overlays it with gold,
and \add he\add* smelts chains of silver.
The one who is \add too\add* impoverished \add for\add* a gift chooses wood \add that\add* will not rot;
he seeks a skillful artisan for himself to set up an image \add that\add* will not be knocked over.
Have you not known?
Have you not heard?
Has it not been told to you from \add the\add* ⸤beginning⸥?\f + \fr 40:21 \ft Literally “head” \f*
Have you not understood \add from\add* the foundation of the earth?
\add He is\add* the one who sits above the circle of the earth,
and its inhabitants \add are\add* like grasshoppers;
the one who stretches out \add the\add* heavens like a veil
and spreads them out like \add a\add* tent to live \add in\add*,
the one who brings\f + \fr 40:23 \ft Or “gives” \f* princes to nothing;
he makes rulers of \add the\add* earth like nothing.
Indeed, hardly are they planted; indeed, hardly \add are they\add* sown;
indeed, hardly has their shoot taken root in the earth
when\f + \fr 40:24 \ft Or “also” \f* he blows on them and they wither,
and \add the\add* tempest carries them like stubble.
“And to whom you will compare me, and am I equal?” says \add the\add* holy one.
Lift your eyes up \add on\add* high, and see! Who created these?
The one who brings out their host by number.
He calls all them by name.
Because \add he is\add* great of power
and mighty of power, no man is missing.
⸤Why⸥\f + \fr 40:27 \ft Literally “To what” \f* do you say, Jacob,
and you speak, Israel,
“My way is hidden from Yahweh,
and my judgment is passed over by my God?”
Have you not known,
or have you not heard?
Yahweh \add is\add* the God of eternity,
\add the\add* creator \add of\add* the ends of the earth!
He is not faint, and he does not grow weary!
There is no searching his understanding.
\add He\add* gives power to the weary,
and he increases power for ⸤the powerless⸥.\f + \fr 40:29 \ft Literally “not power” \f*
Even\f + \fr 40:30 \ft Or “And” \f* young people will be faint and grow weary,
and \add the\add* young will stumble, exhausted.
But\f + \fr 40:31 \ft Or “And” \f* those who wait for Yahweh shall renew \add their\add* strength.
They shall go up \add with\add* wings\f + \fr 40:31 \ft Hebrew “wing” \f* like eagles;
they shall run and not grow weary;
they shall walk and not be faint.
